alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Huron; Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 03 at 3:34AM EST until March 03 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of north central Ohio, northeast Ohio, and northwest Ohio, including the following areas, in north central Ohio, Ashland, Crawford, Huron, Knox, Marion, Morrow, and Richland. In northeast Ohio, Holmes. In northwest Ohio, Hancock, Sandusky, Seneca, Wood, and Wyandot. * From 11 AM EST this morning through late tonight * WHEN...From Friday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong storm system brings widespread rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches to the area. Localized greater amounts are possible across northwest Ohio. This heavy rainfall and wet antecedent soils may lead to river rises and minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
